ARABIC: فَٱرْتَقِبْ يَوْمَ تَأْتِى ٱلسَّمَآءُ بِدُخَانٍ مُّبِينٍ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So be on the watch for a day when heaven brings forth a distinctive smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So watch for the day when the sky begins to emit clear smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So watch for the Day when the sky will come down with a pall of smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Wait for the day (which will come before the Day of Judgment) when the sky will give out dense smoke
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So you await the day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke. –
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: Then wait you for the Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore keep waiting for the day when the heaven shall bring an evident smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So be on the watch for a day when heaven shall bring a manifest smoke
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But watch thou (O Muhammad) for the day when the sky will produce visible smoke
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: Wait, then, for the Day when the sky brings forth plainly visible clouds of smoke.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So wait thou day whereon the heaven will bring forth a manifest smoke:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So watch out for the day when the sky brings on a manifest smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: Then watch thou for the Day that the sky will bring forth a kind of smoke (or mist) plainly visible,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: Then wait you for the Day when the sky will bring forth a visible smoke.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Watch for the Day when the heaven will bring clear smoke,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So watch out for the Day when the sky produces a visible smoke.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: Then watch for the Day when the sky will bring a visible smoke.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [44:10] God, exalted be He, says: So watch out for the day when the heaven will produce a visible smoke. Thus the earth became barren and famine became so severe that they began to see what looked like smoke rising between the heaven and the earth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (But watch thou for) their torment, Muhammad, on (the day when the sky will produce visible smoke) filling what is between the sky and the earth
